name: Apple Blueberry Wheat Loaf (yeast bread, vegan)
description: Apple Blueberry Wheat Loaf. A mildly sweet bread that works well as a sandwich bread, or toasted breakfast, or with jams and jellies! Vegan Recipe.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the yeast and sugar to 1/4 (60ml) cup warm water and mix well. Let stand for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the yeast and sugar to 1/4 (60ml) cup warm water and mix well. Let stand for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, puree the apple and blueberries with a little warm water.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, puree the apple and blueberries with a little warm water.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the flax meal, spices and blend and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the flax meal, spices and blend and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In the mixer bowl add the flours, wheat gluten and salt and mix.
recipeInstructions.name: In the mixer bowl add the flours, wheat gluten and salt and mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the yeast mixture, softened butter, fruit puree and 1/4 cup (60ml) water.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the yeast mixture, softened butter, fruit puree and 1/4 cup (60ml) water.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead the dough for 8-10 minutes, scraping sides every 2-3 minutes. add more flour or water in little quantities if needed. As with any fruit bread, the fruit gives out a little extra moisture than a normal bread while the dough sits for the rising time. The dough should be soft and non sticky.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead the dough for 8-10 minutes, scraping sides every 2-3 minutes. add more flour or water in little quantities if needed. As with any fruit bread, the fruit gives out a little extra moisture than a normal bread while the dough sits for the rising time. The dough should be soft and non sticky.

recipeInstructions.text: Spritz the top of dough with some oil spray. Place dough in a covered container in a warm place for 1.5 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Spritz the top of dough with some oil spray. Place dough in a covered container in a warm place for 1.5 hours.

recipeInstructions.text: Punch it lightly and shape into a loaf by pulling on all sides, or by rolling it out into a rectangle and rolling the rectangle from one side and tucking the other edge under.
recipeInstructions.name: Punch it lightly and shape into a loaf by pulling on all sides, or by rolling it out into a rectangle and rolling the rectangle from one side and tucking the other edge under.

recipeInstructions.text: Place loaf in greased bread pan. Spritz the top with water and then spritz a little oil spray and cover with damp towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Place loaf in greased bread pan. Spritz the top with water and then spritz a little oil spray and cover with damp towel.

recipeInstructions.text: Place it in a warm place or warm oven for about an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Place it in a warm place or warm oven for about an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove towel, spritz top with some water and bake at 375 degrees F for 40 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove towel, spritz top with some water and bake at 375 degrees F for 40 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove bread from pan and let cool for an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove bread from pan and let cool for an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: I usually refrigerate it for another hour before slicing. The breads are usually quite fluffy and soft and refrigeration makes them a bit firm for nice and clean slices!
recipeInstructions.name: I usually refrigerate it for another hour before slicing. The breads are usually quite fluffy and soft and refrigeration makes them a bit firm for nice and clean slices!

keywords: fruit bread, sweet bread, vegan bread recipe
